reviews.review_msg: Dr. Pedri was one of the sweetest and most fun profs I have ever had! She tried to be on a first name basis with all participatory students and regularly related the lecture content to pop culture which made her classes SO engaging. The assignments were largely creativity-based, which leaves a lot of room for students to express themselves. W CLASS

Expectations are very broad and feedback, while detailed (when you sought out), is subjective. When I said that I wouldn't have guessed a particular design feature would have been preferred, as she does not teach design, she became irritated. She should regulate her responses to student queries in response to unclear feedback.

A really great professor. Caring when it comes to personal issues and wants to work with you to succeed. I thoroughly enjoyed her CMNS120W lectures each week. She always checked in with us to see how we were and her lectures were great! Will always recommend.
Dr. Pedri is a caring and enthusiastic professor. Take her and you won't have any issues or miscommunication as to what to expect.
Class was not a grade booster. No clear criteria so you go into assignments completely blind.

This class was not a GPA booster; it brought mine down. I don't think Jennessia is the problem, but the TAs are. They provided little to no help and were impossible to contact. There were no clear criteria, only vague instructions outlining the minimum requirements which won't get you an A. This class was a complete joke. But I blame the bad TA's

Her lectures were genuinely so fun and entertaining. There is no final exam, but I feel like if there was one I would be so prepared because of how much I learned during her class. She does a bunch of creative activities that make it fun and easy.... If you do the activities and are there, you'll do good.

Jennessia is a really nice professor who you can tell is very passionate about what she teaches. She loves to engage with her students - especially in 221, and you can tell she really cares about them. Her lectures are engaging and fun, she uses a lot of current examples which makes it relatable and makes you want to talk about it outside of class.

Loved Dr. Pedri's class! No textbook, quizzes or exams. There were 3 main projects that we were given plenty of time to complete as well as tutorial work blocks. I didn't do a single reading and got an easy A. Lecture attendance and tutorial attendance are for marks so try not to miss any classes. Great class with the sweetest teacher ever!

Dr. Pedri is a very caring prof. In CMNS120W there aren't any exams so we don't get graded on a whole lot of things. She assigns discussion posts every week but that's all that you should look out for. It's all projects and papers which isn't hard at all as long as you show up to the lectures. Attendance matters in her lectures. Take her!

Jennessia is SUCH a wonderful prof, if you are looking for a creative, interactive and fun class to boost your GPA, take CMNS120. Lecture and tutorial attendance is very important, other than that there are only three assignments to do. She is so friendly and kind, I could not recommend this course more!!! You're welcome.
Great Professor! Lectures never get boring.  Grading might be an issue since there is a lot of students but sure did learn a lot.

Lectures take REALLY long to convey a normal amount of content. She also repeats her points a lot, to the point it feels like 5 lectures feel like 2 lectures' worth of content.

Content is easily understandable, but you'll have to prove it in the many many assignments you'll have to write (In-class participation, graded papers, weekly reflections)

The course content and material is very simple - Dr. Pedri does her best to make fairly empty material engaging. She's very kind, relatable, and down to earth.

Dr. Pedri is very understanding, but she has a bad habit of looking past the flaws of her TAs. She protects teaching assistants that are rude, vindictive, and unkind to students.

Dr. Pedri is one of the best professors I've had at SFU. She is so caring and passionate for teaching. I learned more about writing in 120W than I ever did in any other English class. She's always there if you need advice on your papers, project descriptions are detailed and available from the beginning of the semester. If you can, take her class!!

Dr. Pedri is great, super nice and helpful outside of class. Semester long project that doesn't have much instruction. Marking was semi-difficult but not bad. No exams. Definitely recommend this prof!

This class reminds me of a high-school level class. The prof will say "can anyone tell me about (concept)?"  instead of just telling us in depth. It'll be the same 2 dudes who sit at the front who give their own opinions, but it doesn't add at all to what we are learning or what the prof saying. Slides are vague and class activities are boring.
Dr. Pedri's class was so much fun and the lectures were engaging. No final, and you don't really have to do any readings. Take a class with this prof if you can!!!
